SUPPLEMENT TO THE GAZETTEER OF THE BELLARY DISTRICT.

VOLUME I.

Chapter I, page 2—Taluks and chief towns.—The number of taluks was increased from eight to nine owing to the constitution of a new taluk with its head-quarters at Siruguppa in 1910 under Sir William Meyer's scheme.

Chapter VII, page 120—Lines under construction.—The construction of the two branch lines, one from Bellary to Rayadurg and the other from Hospet to Kottur, was completed in 1905 and the lines were opened for traffic from 1st April 1905. They are of much service to the taluks of Rayadurg, Kudligi, Hadagalli and Harpanahalli.

Chapter X, page 147—The Wardlaw College.—The institution was reduced in 1908 from a Second-grade College to a High School.

Chapter X, page 148—Lower Secondary schools.—The management of the Lower Secondary School at Hospet has since been transferred from the Taluk Board to the Hospet Municipality. The management of the Harpanahalli Secondary School has lately been transferred from the Taluk to the District Board.

Chapter XI, page 176—Existing Divisional charges.—The constitution of a division at Rayadurg from 1st October 1910, increased the number of revenue divisions from three to four. The taluks comprised in the divisions are as shown below:

Adoni division ... Adoni and Alur taluks.
Bellary ,, ... Bellary and Siruguppa taluks.
Hospet ,, ... Hospet, Harpanahalli and Hadagalli taluks.
Rayadurg ,, ... Rayadurg and Kudligi taluks.

No. 3 is a division in charge of a Sub-Collector and the others are in charge of Deputy Collectors.

Chapter XII, page 183—District Munsifs' Courts.—The District Munsif of Gooty, within whose jurisdiction the Adoni taluk lies, is no longer subordinate to the District Court of Kurnool, as the appellate jurisdiction was in 1911 transferred to the District Court of Cuddapah.

Chapter XIII, page 184—Registration (Civil Justice).—In addition to the existing ten Sub-Registrars a joint Sub-Registrar was appointed for Bellary taluk in 1910.
The various courts (Criminal Justice).—A bench of Magistrates was constituted at Kottur in addition to the existing benches of Magistrates. Only the Tahsildars of Hadagalli, Harpanahalli and Rayadrug regularly exercise second-class magisterial powers, being assisted by their Taluk Sarishtadars. The criminal cases in the remaining six taluks and in the Bellary town are heard by Stationary Sub-Magistrates and the Sub-Magistrate, Bellary town. There is only one Deputy Tahsildar at Yemmiganur in Adoni exercising second-class powers within his jurisdiction. The four Divisional Magistrates and the District Magistrate have the usual first-class powers.

Chapter XIV, page 191—The Local Boards.—There are four taluk boards at Adoni, Bellary, Hospet and Rayadrug, the last having been formed on the 1st April 1911. The Taluk Boards manage the affairs of the taluks comprised in the revenue divisions of the same name.

The Unions.—The conversion of Hospet Union into a Municipality reduced the number of unions from 19 to 18. The several unions comprised in the Taluk Boards are as shown below:

Adoni Taluk Board. ... Alur, Holagondi, Kowtalam, Kosigi and Yemmiganur.
Bellary ,, ... Hirebal, Kudatiní, Siruguppa and Kuragodu.
Hospet ,, ... Harpanahalli, Hadagalli, Kamalapuram, Kampli and Narayandevarkeri.
Rayadrug ,, ... Rayadrug, Kudligi, Kanekal and Kottur.

Chapter XIV, page 192—The two municipalities.—Hospet was constituted a Municipality from 1st April 1913. The three municipal towns are Bellary, Adoni and Hospet.

Chapter XV, pages 211, 226, 234 and 235.—The narrative portion of the notable places of Harivanam, Kenchanaguddam, Siruguppa and Tekkalakotta, which is now shown under Alur (211) and Bellary (226, 234 and 235) taluks, should be grouped separately under the Siruguppa taluk, as these villages have been included in that taluk.

Chapter XVI, page 316—Administration. The present system.—The present Raja of Sandur was installed in July 1913 and he thereafter took charge of the administration of the State. He is now assisted by a Diwan.
